generatedFromSchema_doNotEdit.title: Minecraft Item v1.21.90 Item
generatedFromSchema_doNotEdit.description: Item definition includes the "description" and "components" sections.

fields.title: Components
fields.description: List of all components used in this item.

subForm.title: Components
subForm.description: List of all components used in this item.

fields.title: Minecraft Allow Off Hand
fields.description: The allow_off_hand component determines whether the item can be placed in the off hand slot of the inventory.

fields.title: Value
fields.description: Determines whether the item can be placed in the off hand slot.

fields.title: Minecraft Block Placer
fields.description:
Items with the block_placer component will place a block when used. 
This component can also be used instead of the "minecraft:icon" component to render the referenced block as the item icon.

subForm.title: Block Placer
subForm.description:
Items with the block_placer component will place a block when used. 
This component can also be used instead of the "minecraft:icon" component to render the referenced block as the item icon.

fields.title: Block
fields.description: Defines the block that will be placed.

fields.title: Replace Block Item
fields.description: If true, the item will be registered as the item for this block. This item will be returned by default when the block is broken/picked. Note: the identifier for this item must match the block's identifier for this field to be valid.

fields.title: Use On
fields.description: List of block descriptors of the blocks that this item can be used on. If left empty, all blocks will be allowed.

fields.title: Minecraft Bundle Interaction
fields.description: [EXPERIMENTAL] Adds bundle-specific interactions and tooltip to the item. Requires a "minecraft:storage_item" component.

subForm.title: Bundle Interaction
subForm.description: [EXPERIMENTAL] Adds bundle-specific interactions and tooltip to the item. Requires a "minecraft:storage_item" component.

fields.title: Num Viewable Slots
fields.description: The maximum number of slots in the bundle viewable by the plater. Can be from 1 to 64. Default is 12.

fields.title: Minecraft Can Destroy In Creative
fields.description: The can_destroy_in_creative component determines if the item can be used by a player to break blocks when in creative mode.

fields.title: Value
fields.description: Determines whether the item can be used to destroy blocks while in creative mode.

fields.title: Minecraft Compostable
fields.description: Specifies that an item is compostable and provides the chance of creating a composting layer in the composter

subForm.title: Compostable
subForm.description: Specifies that an item is compostable and provides the chance of creating a composting layer in the composter

fields.title: Composting Chance
fields.description: The chance of this item to create a layer upon composting with the composter. Valid value range is 1 - 100 inclusive

fields.title: Minecraft Cooldown
fields.description: After you use an item, all items specified with the same `cool down category` setting becomes unusable for the duration specified by the 'cool down time' setting in this component.

subForm.title: Cooldown
subForm.description: After you use an item, all items specified with the same `cool down category` setting becomes unusable for the duration specified by the 'cool down time' setting in this component.

fields.title: Category
fields.description: The type of cool down for this item. All items with a cool down component with the same category are put on cool down when one is used.

fields.title: Duration
fields.description: The duration of time (in seconds) items with a matching category will spend cooling down before becoming usable again.

fields.title: Minecraft Custom Components
fields.description: Specifies an array of custom components defined in a script that should be added to this item.

fields.title: Minecraft Damage
fields.description: The damage component determines how much extra damage the item does on attack.

fields.title: Value
fields.description: Specifies how much extra damage the item does, must be a positive number.

fields.title: Minecraft Damage Absorption
fields.description: It allows an item to absorb damage that would otherwise be dealt to its wearer. For this to happen, the item needs to be equipped in an armor slot. The absorbed damage reduces the item's durability, with any excess damage being ignored. Because of this, the item also needs a `minecraft:durability` component.

subForm.title: Damage Absorption
subForm.description: It allows an item to absorb damage that would otherwise be dealt to its wearer. For this to happen, the item needs to be equipped in an armor slot. The absorbed damage reduces the item's durability, with any excess damage being ignored. Because of this, the item also needs a `minecraft:durability` component.

fields.title: Absorbable Causes
fields.description: List of damage causes that can be absorbed by the item. By default, no damage cause is absorbed.

fields.title: Minecraft Digger
fields.description: Digger item component specifies how quickly this item can dig specific blocks.

subForm.title: Digger
subForm.description: Digger item component specifies how quickly this item can dig specific blocks.

fields.title: Destroy Speeds
fields.description: A list of blocks to dig with correlating speeds of digging.

fields.title: Block
fields.description: Block to be dug.

fields.title: Speed
fields.description: Digging speed for the correlating block(s).

fields.title: Use Efficiency
fields.description: Determines whether this item should be impacted if the efficiency enchantment is applied to it.

fields.title: Minecraft Display Name
fields.description: The display_name item component specifies the text shown whenever an item's name is displayed, like in hover text.

subForm.title: Display Name
subForm.description: The display_name item component specifies the text shown whenever an item's name is displayed, like in hover text.

fields.title: Value
fields.description: Name shown for an item.

fields.title: Minecraft Durability
fields.description: The durability item component specifies how much damage the item takes before breaking, and allows the item to be combined to repair or augment them.

subForm.title: Durability
subForm.description: The durability item component specifies how much damage the item takes before breaking, and allows the item to be combined to repair or augment them.

fields.title: Damage Chance
fields.description: Specifies the percentage chance of this item losing durability. Default is set to 100. Defined as an int range with min and max value.

fields.title: Max Durability
fields.description: Max durability is the amount of damage that this item can take before breaking. This is a required parameter and has a minimum of 0.

fields.title: Minecraft Durability Sensor
fields.description: Enables an item to emit effects when it receives damage. Because of this, the item also needs a `minecraft:durability` component.

subForm.title: Durability Sensor
subForm.description: Enables an item to emit effects when it receives damage. Because of this, the item also needs a `minecraft:durability` component.

fields.title: Durability Thresholds
fields.description: The list of both durability thresholds and effects emitted when each threshold is met. When multiple thresholds are met, only the threshold with the lowest durability after applying the damage is considered.

subForm.title: Durability Sensor Durability Threshold
subForm.description: Defines both the durability threshold, and the effects emitted when that threshold is met.

fields.title: Durability
fields.description: The effects are emitted when the item durability value is less than or equal to this value.

fields.title: ParticleType
fields.description: Particle effect to emit when the threshold is met.

fields.title: LevelSoundEvent
fields.description: Sound effect to emit when the threshold is met.

fields.title: Minecraft Enchantable
fields.description: The enchantable component specifies what enchantments can be applied to the item. Not all enchantments will have an effect on all item components.

subForm.title: Enchantable
subForm.description: The enchantable component specifies what enchantments can be applied to the item. Not all enchantments will have an effect on all item components.

fields.title: Slot
fields.description: Specifies which types of enchantments can be applied. For example, `bow` would allow this item to be enchanted as if it were a bow.

fields.title: Value
fields.description: Specifies the value of the enchantment (minimum of 0).

fields.title: Minecraft Entity Placer
fields.description: The entity_placer item component specifies the blocks that the item can be placed on.

subForm.title: Entity Placer
subForm.description: The entity_placer item component specifies the blocks that the item can be placed on.

fields.title: Dispense On
fields.description: List of block descriptors of the blocks that this item can be dispensed on. If left empty, all blocks will be allowed.

fields.title: Entity
fields.description: The entity to be placed in the world.

fields.title: Use On
fields.description: List of block descriptors of the blocks that this item can be used on. If left empty, all blocks will be allowed.

fields.title: Minecraft Food
fields.description: When an item has a food component, it becomes edible to the player. Must have the 'minecraft:use_duration' component in order to function properly.

subForm.title: Food
subForm.description: When an item has a food component, it becomes edible to the player. Must have the 'minecraft:use_duration' component in order to function properly.

fields.title: Can Always Eat
fields.description: If true you can always eat this item (even when not hungry). Default is set to false.

fields.title: Nutrition
fields.description: Value that is added to the entity's nutrition when the item is used. Default is set to 0.

fields.title: Saturation Modifier
fields.description: saturation_modifier is used in this formula: (nutrition * saturation_modifier * 2) when applying the saturation buff. Default is set to 0.6.

fields.title: Using Converts To
fields.description: When used, converts to the item specified by the string in this field. Default does not convert item.

fields.title: Minecraft Fuel
fields.description: Fuel item component allows this item to be used as fuel in a furnace to 'cook' other items.

fields.title: Duration
fields.description: Amount of time, in seconds, this fuel will cook items.

fields.title: Minecraft Glint
fields.description: The glint component determines whether the item has the enchanted glint render effect on it.

fields.title: Value
fields.description: Determines whether the item has the glint effect.

fields.title: Minecraft Hand Equipped
fields.description: The hand_equipped component determines if an item is rendered like a tool while it is in a player's hand.

fields.title: Value
fields.description: Determines whether the item is rendered like a tool while in the player's hand.

fields.title: Minecraft Hover Text Color
fields.description: The hover_text_color component specifies the color of the item name when the players hovers the cursor over the item.

fields.title: Value
fields.description: Specifies the color of the item's hover text.

fields.title: Minecraft Icon
fields.description: Icon item component determines which icon graphic will be used to represent the item in the UI and elsewhere.

fields.title: Textures
fields.description: This map contains the different textures that can be used for the item's icon. Default will contain the actual icon texture. Armor trim textures and palettes and bundle open textures can be specified here too. The icon textures are the keys from the resource_pack/textures/item_texture.json 'texture_data' object associated with the texture file.

fields.title: Minecraft Interact Button
fields.description: This component is a boolean or string that determines if the interact button is shown in touch controls and what text is displayed on the button. When set as true, default "Use Item" text will be displayed.

fields.title: Minecraft Liquid Clipped
fields.description: The liquid_clipped component determines whether the item interacts with liquid blocks on use.

fields.title: Value
fields.description: Deterines whether the item interacts with liquid blocks on use.

fields.title: Minecraft Max Stack Size
fields.description: The max_stack_size component specifies how many of the item can be stacked together.

fields.title: Value
fields.description: Specifies how many of the item that can be stacked.

fields.title: Minecraft Projectile
fields.description: Projectile items shoot out, like an arrow.

subForm.title: Projectile
subForm.description: Projectile items shoot out, like an arrow.

fields.title: Minimum Critical Power
fields.description: Specifies how long a player must charge a projectile for it to critically hit.

fields.title: Projectile Entity
fields.description: Which entity is to be fired as a projectile.

fields.title: Minecraft Rarity
fields.description: Specifies the base rarity and subsequently color of the item name when the player hovers the cursor over the item.

fields.title: Value
fields.description: Sets the base rarity of the item. The rarity of an item automatically increases when enchanted, either to Rare when the base rarity is Common or Uncommon, or Epic when the base rarity is Rare.

fields.title: Minecraft Record
fields.description: Record Item Component. Used by record items to play music.

subForm.title: Record
subForm.description: Record Item Component. Used by record items to play music.

fields.title: Comparator Signal
fields.description: Specifies signal strength for comparator blocks to use, from 1 - 13.

fields.title: Duration
fields.description: Specifies duration of sound event in seconds, float value.

fields.title: LevelSoundEvent
fields.description: Sound event type: 13, cat, blocks, chirp, far, mall, mellohi, stal, strad, ward, 11, wait, pigstep, otherside, 5, relic.

fields.title: Minecraft Repairable
fields.description: The repairable item component specifies which items can be used to repair this item, along with how much durability is gained.

subForm.title: Repairable
subForm.description: The repairable item component specifies which items can be used to repair this item, along with how much durability is gained.

fields.title: Repair Items
fields.description: List of repair item entries. Each entry needs to define a list of strings for `items` that can be used for the repair and an optional `repair_amount` for how much durability is gained.

fields.title: Items
fields.description: Items that may be used to repair an item.

fields.title: Repair Amount
fields.description: How much the item is repaired.

fields.title: Minecraft Shooter
fields.description: Shooter Item Component.

subForm.title: Shooter
subForm.description: Shooter Item Component.

fields.title: Ammunition
fields.description: Ammunition.

fields.title: Item
fields.description: Ammunition item description identifier.

fields.title: Search Inventory
fields.description: Can search inventory? Default is set to false.

fields.title: Use In Creative
fields.description: Can use in creative mode? Default is set to false.

fields.title: Use Offhand
fields.description: Can use off-hand? Default is set to false.

fields.title: Charge On Draw
fields.description: Charge on draw? Default is set to false.

fields.title: Max Draw Duration
fields.description: Draw Duration. Default is set to 0.

fields.title: Scale Power By Draw Duration
fields.description: Scale power by draw duration? Default is set to false.

fields.title: Minecraft Should Despawn
fields.description: Should_despawn component determines if the item should eventually despawn while floating in the world

fields.title: Value
fields.description: Determines whether the item should eventually despawn while floating in the world.

fields.title: Minecraft Stacked By Data
fields.description: The stacked_by_data component determines whether the same items with different aux values can stack. Also defines whether the item entities can merge while floating in the world.

fields.title: Value
fields.description: Determines whether the same item with different aux values can stack. Also defines whether the item entities can merge while floating in the world.

fields.title: Minecraft Storage Item
fields.description: [EXPERIMENTAL] Storage Items can be used by other components to store other items within this item.

subForm.title: Storage Item
subForm.description: [EXPERIMENTAL] Storage Items can be used by other components to store other items within this item.

fields.title: Allow Nested Storage Items
fields.description: Determines whether another Storage Item is allowed inside of this item. Default is true.

fields.title: Allowed Items
fields.description: List of items that are exclusively allowed in this Storage Item. If empty all items are allowed.

fields.title: Banned Items
fields.description: List of items that are not allowed in this Storage Item.

fields.title: Max Slots
fields.description: The maximum allowed weight of the sum of all contained items. Maximum is 64. Default is 64.

fields.title: Minecraft Storage Weight Limit
fields.description: Specifies the maximum weight limit that a storage item can hold

subForm.title: Storage Weight Limit
subForm.description: Specifies the maximum weight limit that a storage item can hold

fields.title: Max Weight Limit
fields.description: The maximum allowed weight of the sum of all contained items. Maximum is 64. Default is 64.

fields.title: Minecraft Storage Weight Modifier
fields.description: Specifies the maximum weight limit that a storage item can hold

subForm.title: Storage Weight Modifier
subForm.description: Specifies the maximum weight limit that a storage item can hold

fields.title: Weight In Storage Item
fields.description: The weight of this item when inside another Storage Item. Default is 4. 0 means item is not allowed in another Storage Item.

fields.title: Minecraft Tags
fields.description: The tags component specifies which tags an item has on it.

subForm.title: Tags
subForm.description: The tags component specifies which tags an item has on it.

fields.title: Tags
fields.description: An array that can contain multiple item tags.

fields.title: Minecraft Throwable
fields.description: Throwable items can be thrown by the player, such as a snowball.

subForm.title: Throwable
subForm.description: Throwable items can be thrown by the player, such as a snowball.

fields.title: Do Swing Animation
fields.description: Determines whether the item should use the swing animation when thrown. Default is set to false.

fields.title: Launch Power Scale
fields.description: The scale at which the power of the throw increases. Default is set to 1.0.

fields.title: Max Draw Duration
fields.description: The maximum duration to draw a throwable item. Default is set to 0.0.

fields.title: Max Launch Power
fields.description: The maximum power to launch the throwable item. Default is set to 1.0.

fields.title: Min Draw Duration
fields.description: The minimum duration to draw a throwable item. Default is set to 0.0.

fields.title: Scale Power By Draw Duration
fields.description: Whether or not the power of the throw increases with duration charged. Default is set to false.

fields.title: Minecraft Use Animation
fields.description: Use_animation specifies which animation is played when the player uses the item.

fields.title: Animation
fields.description: Specifies which animation to play when the the item is used.

fields.title: Minecraft Use Modifiers
fields.description: This component modifies use effects, including how long the item takes to use and the player's speed when used in combination with components like "shooter", "throwable", or "food".

subForm.title: Use Modifiers
subForm.description: This component modifies use effects, including how long the item takes to use and the player's speed when used in combination with components like "shooter", "throwable", or "food".

fields.title: Movement Modifier
fields.description: Modifier value to scale the players movement speed when item is in use.

fields.title: Use Duration
fields.description: How long the item takes to use in seconds.

fields.title: Minecraft Wearable
fields.description: Wearable items can be worn by a player in a specified slot.

subForm.title: Wearable
subForm.description: Wearable items can be worn by a player in a specified slot.

fields.title: Hides Player Location
fields.description: Determines whether the Player's location is hidden on Locator Maps and the Locator Bar when the wearable item is worn. Default is false.

fields.title: Protection
fields.description: How much protection the wearable item provides. Default is set to 0.

fields.title: EquipmentSlot
fields.description: Specifies where the item can be worn. If any non-hand slot is chosen, the max stack size is set to 1.

fields.title: Description
fields.description: Contains the required identifier for the item. May contain optional fields like menu_category.

subForm.title: Description
subForm.description: Contains the required identifier for the item. May contain optional fields like menu_category.

fields.title: Identifier
fields.description: Unique name for the item that must include a namespace and must not use the Minecraft namespace unless overriding a Vanilla item.

fields.title: Menu Category
fields.description: menu_category contains the creative group name and category for this item.

subForm.title: Menu Category
subForm.description: menu_category contains the creative group name and category for this item.

fields.title: CreativeItemCategory
fields.description: Creative category where this item belongs. Defaults to "none".

fields.title: Group
fields.description: The Creative Group that this item belongs to. Group name is limited to 256 characters. The name also must start with a namespace.

fields.title: Is Hidden In Commands
fields.description: Determines whether or not this item can be used with commands. Commands can use items by default if a category is set.
